title: Practical Application Course for Materials Informatics Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic machine learning techniques and materials science data analysis
context.additional_context: A practice-centered training program for current professionals, emphasizing solutions to material optimization problems encountered in actual industrial settings

learning_goals: They can design and implement a material data preprocessing pipeline (generation, refinement, validation, encoding).
They can build a material property prediction system using XGBoost, Random Forest, and SVM models.
They can develop practical skills to derive a balance between target efficiency and confidence intervals by applying Bayesian optimization techniques.
One can explain the data quality evaluation process through RDDT (Regression Deviation Threshold) and R:M ratio analysis

resources: Python-Based Machine Learning Libraries (Scikit-learn, XGBoost, etc.)
LMS Platform (Video Lectures, Quizzes, Assignment Submission Features)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
